content:
Diagnosis
	1. Clear cell carcinoma of ovary with liver metastases
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	Carboplatin/Paclitaxel - 2 cycles completed with disease progression

	Clinical studies
	Phase II CLARITY trial - ARID1A-targeted therapy vs standard of care
	Randomised to experimental arm March 2024

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver

	Current issues
	Fatigue, abdominal pain, early satiety

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today for cycle 2 assessment on CLARITY trial. Unfortunately, CT performed on 15/4/24 shows significant progression of liver metastases with largest lesion increasing from 4.2cm to 6.8cm. New ascites noted. Trial-specific quality of life scores show deterioration, particularly in domains of fatigue and appetite. Performance status has declined to ECOG 2.

Trial-specific blood samples collected today show grade 2 transaminitis (ALT 187, AST 165). Previous grade 1 nausea now adequately controlled with additional domperidone.

Given clear evidence of disease progression on imaging and clinical deterioration, we have made the decision to discontinue trial treatment as per protocol. Patient and family in agreement.

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT in 2 weeks to establish new baseline

	Medication prescribed
	Domperidone 10mg TDS

	Follow up
	Urgent appointment arranged in general oncology clinic next week to discuss standard second-line treatment options

	Required actions
	Trial discontinuation forms completed
Trial samples processed as per protocol
Urgent referral to palliative care team

cancer_timeline.value: Randomised to experimental arm of CLARITY trial with ARID1A-targeted therapy
CT shows progression of liver metastases, largest lesion increased from 4.2cm to 6.8cm, new ascites
Discontinued from CLARITY trial due to disease progression

status_updates.value: Clear cell ovarian cancer with liver metastases progressing through first-line chemotherapy and experimental trial therapy. Clinical deterioration with worsening liver metastases and new ascites.
Progressive disease with enlarging liver metastases and new ascites
Discontinued from CLARITY trial due to disease progression
Deterioration in performance status to ECOG 2 with worsening quality of life scores
Repeat CT in 2 weeks to establish new baseline
Urgent appointment in general oncology clinic next week to discuss second-line treatment options
